ajk.elderberry

Class TaxiiConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ajk.elderberry.TaxiiConnection

  • public class TaxiiConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    The TaxiiConnection supports the following features:
    • HTTP Proxy
    • Basic authentication
    • SSL certificate authentication
    • custom JAXB marshaller
    • custom RestTemplate

    The SSL certificate authentication can be used by supplying the trust store and key store, or by supplying the certificate in PEM format.
    The following is an example of a private key in PEM PKCS#8 format:

      -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
   c29tZSB0ZXh0IHRvIG1pbWljIGEgYmFzZSA2NCBlbmNvZGVkIGtleQo
   ...encoded text....
   YW5kIGV2ZW4gbW9yZSB0ZXh0IHRvIHNpbXVsYXRlIHRoZSBzYW1lIHR
   oaW5nCg==
   -----END PRIVATE KEY-----

    And the following is an example of a certificate in PEM format:

      -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
   c29tZSB0ZXh0IHRvIG1pbWljIGEgYmFzZSA2NCBlbmNvZGVkIGtleQo
   ...encoded text....
   YW5kIGV2ZW4gbW9yZSB0ZXh0IHRvIHNpbXVsYXRlIHRoZSBzYW1lIHR
   oaW5nCg==
   -----END CERTIFICATE-----

    There are several options to configure 2-way SSL authenticate when the TAXII server requires SSL authentication:

    • Directly set the key store and trust store as KeyStore objects. In this option you can construct the key and trust store in any way you want and provide it to the connection. The key store is expected to contain the client certificate, the client certificate private key and the client certificate chain. The trust store is expected to contain the server trusted certificates. To use this option use setKeyStore(KeyStore, String) and setTrustStore(KeyStore)
    • Provide the key store file and password and trust store file and password. This is very similar to the previous option, except that the TaxiiConnection} takes care of loading the key and trust stores from the files provided. To use this option use setKeyStoreFile(File), setKeyStorePassword(String) to set the key store and setTrustStoreFile(File) and setTrustStorePassword(String) to set the trust store.
    • Provide the client and server certificates using PEM strings. This is probably the most convenient way to setup the SSL connection because you're likely to have PEM certificates and private key rather than JKS stores. To set the client certificate provide the private key as PEM with setPrivateKeyPem(String) and provide the client certificate chain as PEM with setClientCertificatePemChain(List). Provide the trusted certificates with setTrustedPemCertificates(List).
      When constructing the key store and trust store from PEMs you can retrieve the constructed stores back from the connection. This could be useful when caching the store locally.

    The TaxiiConnection can be used with both Taxii11Template and Taxii10Template.

    • Method Detail

      • setKeyStore

        public void setKeyStore(java.security.KeyStore keyStore,
                        java.lang.String keyPassword)
        optional key store that contains your private key to be sent when the server is using SSL certificate-based authentication. It's expected that the key store would hold a single private key and its supporting certificates
        Parameters:
        keyStore - a standard Java key store
        keyPassword - the private key password

      • setTrustStore

        public void setTrustStore(java.security.KeyStore trustStore)
        optional trust store that contains the TAXII server's trusted certificates
        Parameters:
        trustStore - a trust store (which is a standard Java key store)

      • setKeyStorePassword

        public void setKeyStorePassword(java.lang.String keyStorePassword)
        optional key store password, used when the key store is set as a file using setKeyStoreFile(File)
        Parameters:
        keyStorePassword - the key store password

      • setKeyStoreFile

        public void setKeyStoreFile(java.io.File keyStoreFile)
        optional key store file. If set the key store will be loaded from this file using the password set by setKeyStorePassword(String)
        Parameters:
        keyStoreFile - the key store file

      • setTrustStoreFile

        public void setTrustStoreFile(java.io.File trustStoreFile)
        optional trust store file. If set the trust store will be loaded from the file using the password set by setTrustStorePassword(String)

        trustStoreFile - the trust store file

      • setPrivateKeyPem

        public void setPrivateKeyPem(java.lang.String keyPem)
        sets the private key of the client certificate chain. Use this together with setClientCertificatePemChain(List)
        Parameters:
        keyPem - the private key PEM text

      • setClientCertificatePemChain

        public void setClientCertificatePemChain(java.util.List<java.lang.String> clientCertificatePemChain)
        sets the client certificate chain
        Parameters:
        clientCertificatePemChain - the client certificate chain in PEM format. The client certificate itself is expected to be the first item. Note that this is an ordered list of certificates in PEM format, according to their order in the chain bottom to top

      • setTrustedPemCertificates

        public void setTrustedPemCertificates(java.util.List<java.lang.String> trustedPemCertificates)
        sets the trusted certificates. These certificates represent the server-side trusted certificates
        Parameters:
        trustedPemCertificates - the trusted certificates in PEM format

      • getKeyStore

        public java.security.KeyStore getKeyStore()
        a convenient way to externally cache the key store would be to create it from PEMs using setPrivateKeyPem(String) and setClientCertificatePemChain(List) then obtaining it with this method and storing it for future use.

        This method attempts to retrieve the key store in the following algorithm:

        • When it was already loaded or constructed it's returned
        • When it was directly set by setKeyStore(KeyStore, String) then this key store is returned
        • When a key store file and passowrd was set by setKeyStoreFile(File) and setKeyStorePassword(String), then the key store is loaded from the file and returned
        • When a private key was set by setPrivateKeyPem(String) and its certificate chain was set by setClientCertificatePemChain(List) then a new key store is created, the private key material and the client certificates are loaded into it, then this new key store is returned
        Returns:
        the key store

      • getTrustStore

        public java.security.KeyStore getTrustStore()
        a convenient way to externally cache the trust store would be to create it from PEMs using setTrustedPemCertificates(List) then obtaining it with this method and storing it for future use.

        This method attempts to retrieve the trust store using the following algorithm:

        • When it was already loaded or constructed it's returned
        • When it was directly set by setTrustStore(KeyStore) then this trust store is returned
        • When a trust store file and password was set by setTrustStoreFile(File) and setTrustStorePassword(String), then the trust store is loaded from the file and returned
        • When a trusted list of certificates was set by setTrustedPemCertificates(List) then a new trust store is created and the trusted certificates are loaded into it and then this new trust store is returned
        Returns:
        the trust store

      • getKeyPassword

        public java.lang.String getKeyPassword()
        when creating the key store from PEMs the key is stored with a randomly generated password. Use this method to obtain this random password if you want to externally cache and re-use the key store
        Returns:
        the private key password

      • setDiscoveryUri

        public void setDiscoveryUri(java.net.URI discoveryUrl)
        the only required property. Set this URL to point to the discovery URL of your TAXII server.
        Parameters:
        discoveryUrl - For example: https://threatcentral.io/tc/taxii/discovery

        optional username for servers that require basic authentication
        Parameters:

        public void setPassword(java.lang.String password)
        optional password for servers that require basic authentication
        Parameters:

      • setUseProxy

        public void setUseProxy(boolean useProxy)
        a flag to request the use of an http/s proxy to access the TAXII server
        Parameters:
        useProxy - when true the connection will attempt to setup an http/s proxy, depending on the setDiscoveryUri(URI). This is considered a request because it depends on the setProxyHost(String), see details there.

      • setProxyHost

        public void setProxyHost(java.lang.String proxyHost)
        optional proxy hostname
        Parameters:
        proxyHost - if useProxy is true and this property is not specified, then the template will attempt to obtain the hostname from the system property http.proxyHost or https.proxyHost, depending on the discoveryUrl scheme

      • setProxyPort

        public void setProxyPort(int proxyPort)
        optional proxy port
        Parameters:
        proxyPort - if useProxy is true and this property is not specified, then the template will attempt to obtain the port from the system property http.proxyPort or https.proxyPort, depending on the discoveryUrl scheme

        an optional Jaxb2Marshaller
        Parameters:
        marshaller - if not provided then the template will create its own marshaller. This marshaller is expected to be able to marshal and unmarshal TAXII 1.1 XMLs into and from objects

        Parameters:
